name: Treasure Mammal "Checkognize" 12" Vinyl LP Album
description:
1. Dikembe Mutumbo 04:55

2. Real Talk 03:25

3. Bromance 01:30

4. Shake Weight 03:47

5. Desert Livin 00:57

6. Maverick 02:35

7. Kokopelli remix by Jamuel Saxon 05:44

8. Just the Way You Are 02:20

9. Munching Mouth Microscope 00:51

10. Dream Girl 04:17

11. Stevie Wonder to the Bullshit 02:47

12. Checkognize 02:42

All these record covers were printed by hand and the vinyl was pressed on mixed color vinyl so each is one is different.

"Checkognize" Review 

http://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/2012-04-05/music/treasure-mammal-s-checkognize-is-seriously-funny/

name: Treasure MammaL "Wizard" Shirt
description:
At present, all shirts in this category are one of a kind recycled clothing: no two are alike. So tell us your size, more than one color you might like, and any other info about you that would help us pick a shirt to suit you! i.e. "I'm big in the middle, but have narrow shoulders." or "my dick sticks out of the top of my pants and I need a shirt long enough to cover it."

    SHIPPING IS INCLUDED IN PURCHASE PRICE 


                      Shake-Weight not included

name: Knewage CD
description:
Featuring the songs: 

Everybody is a Winner 
Consumer 
Ipod
Amethyst
Dream Catcher 
Kokopelli 
EPT
Day Life
Sun
Be the Best

In the spring of 2008 we went to Sedona, Arizona to visit the vortexes and do a sweat lodge ceremony with our motivational shaman. We were hangin’ out in the sweat lodge when the shaman asked “What’s the deal with your last album?” 
“What do you mean?” Abe said.
“Well, I liked the music, but I want to talk to you about the art…”
“You didn’t like the art?” Dave asked.
“My concern is that you put the Kokopelli in the dreamcatcher”, said the shaman. “Do you even know what you’ve done?”
“We just thought it looked cool as a design—a Kokopelli superimposed on a dreamcatcher background…”
“--Listen to me you two,” the Shaman interrupted, “The Kokopelli is a pedophile, a child molester, and you put him in the dream catcher which captures bad dreams in its web and lets the good ones go through—so basically, you’re saying: fuck the world!”
We were both naked except for the rawhide dreamcatcher necklaces we were wearing: the shaman reached out and grabbed our dreamcatchers and tore them off simultaneously.
“You don’t even know what these mean!” 
We sat quietly in the sweatlodge for a moment, not knowing what to say.
The shaman spoke again, “You will not grow until you make it right with the spirits. You will write another album and you will not leave this lodge until it is finished...”
He handed us an old Casio keyboard with a Kokopelli sticker on it and said, “Compose songs of happiness, joy, beauty, truth and motivation…I also would like to hear a song about an ipod and the emergency pregnancy test.”

PRICE INCLUDES SHIPPING!

name: The Chronicles of Sheriff Joe Arpaio 7"
description:
This is a legendary release called "The Chronicles of Sheriff Joe Arpaio" which is out on Kingdom Mammalia Records. It features 4 of Phoenix, Arizona's best bands (Andrew Jackson Jihad, Treasure Mammal, Father's Day, and Porches) and is on pink vinyl. This compilation is about Joe Arpaio who is the Sheriff of Maricopa County in Arizona: he is one of America's biggest racist/bigot/egomaniacs. This record has received quite a bit of press already and has been in the news again because a band named "The Crocodiles" from San Diego called a song "Kill Joe Arpaio."  Well, sorry crocodile, Andrew Jackson Jihad said they were going to kill Joe first and it was on this awesome record! 

Side A 

Track 1: Father's Day - Americas Toughest Sheriff
Track 2: Porches - Fascist Burritos

Side B: 

Track 3: Treasure Mammal - Arpayaso
Track 4: Andrew Jackson Jihad - Joe Arpaio is a Punk

name: Expect the Max
description: Treasure MammaL "Expect the Max" is the soundtrack to your next DMT trip. Collages of noises, samples, and Casio keyboards bubble to the top like some sort of John Zorn or Mike Patton bastard side project. Occasionally as abrasive as Atari Teenage Riot with thickly distorted blast beats and keyboards, Treasure MammaL isn’t afraid to tear down any barrier, exploring new territory seemingly with each song. Drug users be wary, this might be too mindblowing to use as the backdrop to your next heavy trip.
